result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:12 a.m. Defendant Maria R Niemczyk in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF64 and 15CM39.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
15CF64 Ct 1: I/S Sentence: Prison 24 months Incarcerated and 18 mo ES - stay: 30 mo Probation: Pay $200 fine + costs + DNA surcharge. 50 hrs Community Service.   AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. Maintain fulltime employment.  Engage and comply in any other counseling. Count 2 to be DRI.  15CM39 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 15CF64 Ct 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF64 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
  15CF64 Count 2 and 15CM39 are dismissed and read in. 

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt concurs with the joint agreement. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:********PROBATION*******
 W/H Sentence: 30 mo Probation: 
Conditions:
Pay $200 fine + costs + Drug abuse + DNA surcharge. Bond to be applied and balance to be paid during probation.
50 hrs Community Service.  25 must be with the Portage County Park dept. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.   
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
 Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Comply with all the conditions of the CHIPS Order. 
Engage and comply in any other counseling.  
9 days jail credit.

ADDRESS INFO for Maria R Niemczyk
Current: 4755 Hayes Ave #54, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 02-23-2015)
Prior: 1430 Torun Road #117, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Pre-trial conference on February 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Maria R Niemczyk appeared by video. Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued. 

Atty Schmidt makes statements re: Count 1.  Consents to oral amendment of the complaint in that regard.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Controlled Substances w/o Valid Prescription for 15GF25 (Maria Niemczyk) and Delivery of a Controlled Substance In a Jail for 15GF24 (Dawn Darst).
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

State requests bond and conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  2/9/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
